name: Muslim American Youth Foundation
mission: Our mission is to educate and instil a drive for personal academic success, enrich through experience and expansion of what is really possible, and enlighten by means of taking the aforementioned experiences and incorporating them into their personal lives, households and communities.
theoryOfChange: Educate, Enrich, and Enlighten: providing culturally relevant and spiritually grounded programs (inputs) to strengthen identity and values (outputs) to enable youth to lead and uplift communities (outcomes).
zakatClaimEvidence: No explicit mention of "zakat" on the organization's donation pages or website content found in the search results. The organization's mission focuses on empowering and uplifting Muslim-American youth through education, sports, and community engagement, but does not specify zakat acceptance. (Source: https://www.mayf.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: The organization reported a total revenue of $1,734,105 and a program expense ratio of 72.1%.
Financial records indicate a fundraising efficiency of $0.03 per $1 raised and working capital of 13.4 months.
The foundation's mission is to create and operate a facility for youth education, enrichment, and enlightenment through programs like youth sports and mentoring.
The organization accepts sadaqah and general donations to support its community facilities.
Community members can engage with the foundation through various volunteer opportunities.

areas_for_improvement: Limited public data regarding specific long-term program outcomes
Low data confidence due to reliance on basic financial filings

dimension_explanations.alignment: As a domestic youth-focused charity, the organization addresses the urgent need for community spaces and mentorship [3]. It offers a medium fit for Muslim donors seeking to support local sadaqah-eligible initiatives, though it lacks the extensive track record or transparency required for a higher alignment rating [4][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates a high capacity for service delivery, allocating 72.1% of its $1,734,105 revenue directly to programs such as youth sports and mentoring [1][2]. While the organization holds 13.4 months of working capital to ensure operational stability, there is limited third-party verification of specific educational outcomes [3].

Healthy liquidity with 13.4 months of working capital available
High program expense ratio of 72.1% dedicated to direct services

With a total revenue of $1,734,105, the foundation manages a variety of community services and mentoring programs designed to support local youth [1][2].

strengths.detail: The organization is highly efficient at generating revenue, spending only <cite id="1">$0.03 per $1 raised</cite>.
MAYF has demonstrated significant financial expansion with a <cite id="4">73.3% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>.
The foundation maintains strong financial reserves, with <cite id="1">13.4 months of working capital</cite> available for operations.

strengths_deep_dive: The Muslim American Youth Foundation has established a strong financial foundation for its community programs. The organization's <cite id="4">73.3% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite> indicates rapidly growing community support and expanding operational capacity. Furthermore, its fundraising efficiency is notable, requiring only <cite id="1">$0.03 per $1 raised</cite>, ensuring that the vast majority of contributions are available for its core mission of youth education and mentoring.
rich_narrative.summary: The Muslim American Youth Foundation (MAYF) is a community-focused organization that provides a dedicated facility for the education, enrichment, and enlightenment of youth through sports and mentoring. Operating primarily in the United States, the foundation delivers programs such as <cite id="3">Youth Sports, Athletics & Mentoring, and Faith Programs</cite>. In 2023, the organization reported <cite id="2">$1,734,105 in total revenue</cite>, reflecting significant recent growth with a <cite id="4">73.3% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>. The foundation maintains a <cite id="2">72.1% program expense ratio</cite>, directing the majority of its funding toward direct community services. MAYF demonstrates exceptional fundraising efficiency, spending just <cite id="1">$0.03 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization operates with a <cite id="5">board of 5 members</cite> and focuses on capacity building and domestic poverty alleviation. While the foundation shows strong financial growth and liquidity, it currently has <cite id="6">low data confidence</cite> due to limited public transparency regarding specific long-term program outcomes and beneficiary metrics. Donations to MAYF are <cite id="3">sadaqah-eligible</cite>, supporting vital community infrastructure for Muslim youth.
